hero.welcomeMessage: A full P2P protocol written entirely in JavaScript
hero.textDescription: js-ipfs paves the path for the Browser implementation of the IPFS protocol. Written entirely in JavaScript, it **runs in a Browser tab, a Service Worker, a Web Extension and also in Node.js**, opening the door to a world of possibilities.

banner.highlightMessage: The js-ipfs library is in Alpha state.
banner.message: The codebase hasn't been audited by Security specialists and it shouldn't be used to store, share or publish sensitive information.

features.sectionDesc: Packed with all the things you know and love about IPFS. This implementationt also carries some extra neat things that are unique to the Browser. It's the toolkit to power all your DWeb Applications.

list.title: Run on Node.js and the Browser
list.desc: js-ipfs works out of the box on Node.js, Electron and any modern browser. It is also customizable by design so that you can use it on your favorite runtime.

list.title: Implements the full IPFS Stack
list.desc: No feature was left behind. js-ipfs is not a light client, it is the full implementation of the IPFS protocol.

list.title: Use PubSub to communicate realtime with the other peers
list.desc: IPFS nodes can create network topologies based on topics of interest to broadcast events in Realtime.

list.title: Add and retrieve files from anywhere in the IPFS Network
list.desc: IPFS is designed to use the power of Content Addressing and Process Addressing to find the nodes in the network that have the content you are looking for and retrieve it. In the same way, you can add any piece of data and other nodes will find it too.

list.title: Use the DAG API to traverse over any hash linked data structure
list.desc: IPFS uses [IPLD](https://ipld.io/), the InterPlanetary Linked-Data, a model that enables you interact with data from multiple sources, such as git, blockchains and more.

list.title: libp2p is built in
list.desc: libp2p is the Modular Networking Stack that was born for IPFS and now you can use it through IPFS for your application directly as well.

list.title: Run it as a daemon
list.desc: js-ipfs also comes with the option to run it as a daemon so that you can interact with it using the HTTP API that you are familiar from go-ipfs.

list.title: It can handle naming for mutabilitys
list.desc: It comes with IPNS, the Interplanetary Naming System, a way to author mutable pointers (records) so that you distribute updates in a authenticated and certified way.

list.title: Install
list.desc: This project is available through npm. To install run:
list.note: Requires npm@3 and node@6 or above, tested on OSX & Linux, expected to work on Windows.

list.title: Through command line tool
list.desc: In order to use js-ipfs as a CLI, you must install it with the global flag. Run the following (even if you have ipfs installed locally):
list.note: The CLI is available by using the command jsipfs in your terminal. This is aliased, instead of using ipfs, to make sure it does not conflict with the Go implementation.

list.title: Use in the browser
list.desc:
Learn how to bundle with browserify and webpack in the examples folder.

You can also load it using a <script> using the unpkg CDN or the jsDelivr CDN. Inserting one of the following lines will make a Ipfs object available in the global namespace.
list.note: Inserting one of the above lines will make an Ipfs object available in the global namespace.

serviceWorker.sectionDesc: Turn this page into a full IPFS Gateway without touching any servers or using HTTP to fetch content from the IPFS Network! Yes, you read it right, the Service Worker Gateway with js-ipfs can connect directly to the IPFS Network.

whatCanYouBuildTitle: What you can build with js-ipfs

whatArePeopleBuilding.sectionTitle: What people are building with it

list.desc: Paratii builds open source technology for video streaming and curation, with js-ipfs and Ethereum contracts. The Portal is a web app with curated crypto-related videos that runs on IPFS.
The Decentralized WeTransfer. Filenation is the simplest way to send your files around the world using IPFS, it lets you send files as a link to an email using IPFS.

PeerPad is a collaborative real-time editor that works on the decentralised web, built on top of IPFS and Y.js. It uses no second or third-party: all participating nodes talk directly to each other without a central service.

Give your Browser super powers with the IPFS Web Extension. IPFS Companion is an extension that can be used in Chrome, Firefox and the Brave Browsers to give you access to the IPFS Network seemlessly. It also packs extra features such as file sharing and APIs for Web Developers.

[Orbit Chat](https://orbit.chat) is a serverless, distributed, peer-to-peer chat application built on top of OrbitDB. OrbitDB uses [IPFS](https://ipfs.io) as its data storage and [IPFS Pubsub](https://ipfs.io/blog/29-js-ipfs-pubsub) to automatically sync databases with peers.

publicationsAndTalks.sectionDesc: Watch project updates, demos and other talks by the IPFS Community on the JavaScript project of IPFS. We will be adding dozens of more talks soon that got recorded on the IPFS Dev Meetings.

community.sectionDesc: js-ipfs is an MIT Licensed, Open Source project from the IPFS community. There are many ways you can contribute by getting involved: you can help write the specification, code implementations and tools using libp2p, craft examples and tutorials, and join our regular product calls to discuss libp2p with us.
